Sheridan College Admission is ongoing for all interested candidates who wish to apply for admission; the Admission is as follows.

Sheridan  College Admission Requirements

English Language Proficiency can be demonstrating successful completion with one of the following in each of the Program;

English Language Proficiency for certificate or Diploma Programs

Test Required Minimum Scores
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) iBT overall score 80 with no individual section below 20
TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition2 general score 80 with no individual section below 20
iTEP Academic2 overall score 3.7
IELTS (International English Language Testing System) Academic Module General grade score of  6 with no individual band below 5.5
PTE A (Pearson Test of English Academic) a general score  of 58 with no individual section less than 49
Cambridge English Exams (B2 First/C1 Advanced/C2 Proficiency) overall Cambridge English Scale score 169 with no individual score below 162
Sheridan EAP (English for Academic Purposes) 70% in grade score
Sheridan EPA (English Proficiency Assessment) Listening Band – 4.0
Reading Combined Band – 4.0
Writing – CLB 7
CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language) General grade score of 60 with no individual section less than 50

 English Language Requirements for Degree Programs

Test  Required Minimum Scores
TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) iBT a general score of 88 with no individual section below 21
TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition2  An academic general score of 88 with no individual section lesser than 21.
iTEP Academic2 A general overall score of 3.9.
IELTS (International English Language Testing System) Academic Module overall score 6.5 with no individual band below 6.0
PTE A (Pearson Test of English Academic) generally score  of 60 with no individual section below 57
Cambridge English Exams (B2 First/C1 Advanced/C2 Proficiency) overall Cambridge English Scale score 176 with no individual score below 169
Sheridan EAP (English for Academic Purposes) 75%
Sheridan EPA (English Proficiency Assessment) Listening Band – 4.5
Reading Combined Band – 4.5
Writing – CLB 8
CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language) general score  grade 70 with no individual section below 60

Is it Hard to get into Sheridan College

The difficulty of getting into Sheridan College can vary depending on the program and the number of applicants. Generally speaking, Sheridan College is considered to be a moderately selective college with admission requirements that vary by program.

Some programs at Sheridan College may have more competitive admission requirements and a lower acceptance rate than others, especially those in highly sought-after fields such as animation, game design, and film and television production. In general, it’s important to carefully review the admission requirements for your chosen program and submit a strong application that highlights your academic achievements, relevant experience, and fit with the program to increase your chances of being admitted.

It’s worth noting that Sheridan College has a highly respected reputation for its programs in art and design, animation, film and television, and business, and that a degree from Sheridan College can be highly valued by employers in these industries.

Sheridan College  Admission Full-time Tuition

Students are considered full-time if they take more than 70% of the required credits or 2/3 of the required courses for their program.
